sections: Showcasing Nissanâ€™s most advanced technology of the time, the 300ZX was one of the best selling sports cars of the 1990s. At the top of the line were the Z32 Twin Turbo models.
Finished in Glacier Pearl Metallic Tricoat over a charcoal grey interior, this
is a prime example of what made the 300ZX so desirable. With 300-horsepower, a sleek sporty style, and a premium leather interior,
is as comfortable as it is quick, and with its special finish it is sure to draw attention wherever it goes.
According to its current owner and verified by a paint thickness gauge test, the finish on

is original with only minor touch ups in spots. Inside, is a charcoal grey interior with reupholstered power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, power windows, and a Bose sound system. All accessories are working as intended and the A/C has recently been repaired.

Under the hood is a 3.0-liter twin-turbocharged DOHC V6 engine rated at 300-horsepower and 283 lb.-ft of torque from the factory. This power is fed through a 5-speed manual transmission to a limited-slip differential. Other performance options include a High Capacity Actively Controlled Suspension four-wheel steering system, 4-piston brake calipers, and 11-inch brake rotors and its suspension is adjustable between Sport and Touring modes. However,

is boasting a bit more performance than it did from the factory. Upgrades in the form of a stainless-steel cat-back exhaust system and a Stillen ECU performance chip have been tastefully added and a timing belt and water pump service have been performed.
is now listed for sale on

with just over 60k-miles showing. This is an awesome opportunity to get behind the wheel of one of the most admired sports cars to come out of the 1990s. Included with the car is a collection of records, a service manual, and a clean title.  For more information on this true modern classic click
